Pluto MaLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 09 Mar 2019I did both as a beginner and i would advise you to allocate and diversify carefully.P2P is short term. I allocated a small amount and am prepared to lose all my capital. For my robo-advisor, I set a longer time frame of 10 years with reasonable risk setting while evaluting yearly whether to increase/decrease the risk and amount.It is worth noting that P2P definietly has much higher returns even than my equities (but then I am not that good at investing) but the risk is also much higher and i would caution you to think twice on the amount you allocate.0 comments0
